alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 29 at 1:35AM HST until January 29 at 3:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... At 135 AM HST, emergency management reported that Makawao Avenue and South Kihei Road have been closed due to flooding. Heavy rain continues over portions of Maui. The most intense rain was near the Haiku and Pauwela areas with rates of 1 to 3 inches per hour. Heavy rainfall was also over the slopes of the West Maui Mountains between Wailuku and Waikapu. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. This warning includes the entire island of Maui. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
